title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Make a real product with Gemini

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this video covers "Prompt Chaining"—using a context file to teach AI about your project history and then using the Gemini web app as a "Project Manager". It demonstrates how Gemini can write technical instructions for the Gemini CLI to build complex features, with invoice generation as an example, and points to a full course with interactive demos and labs.
bullets: Explains prompt chaining and using a context file to encode project history for AI.
Shows the Gemini web app acting as a "Project Manager."
Demonstrates generating technical instructions for the Gemini CLI.
Uses invoice generation as a concrete example of a complex feature.
Links to a full course with interactive demos and labs.
takeaways: Provides a workflow to turn project history into actionable AI-driven instructions for tooling and automation.
Illustrates how AI can produce CLI-level technical guidance for implementing complex features.
Relevant for teams that need repeatable ways to translate product requirements into executable developer tasks.
Points to training resources (course and labs) for hands-on adoption of the approach.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… The podcast episode explains how AI tools are already integrated into audit work at KPMG, supporting repetitive tasks, analysis of full data populations and faster, better-informed decisions. Speakers highlight specific tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI and the KPMG Clara platform), the shift from sampling to population analysis, changes to auditors' roles, and implementation, security and regulatory challenges.
bullets: AI automates repetitive audit tasks and enables analysis of entire data populations rather than just samples.
Tools discussed include AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI (conversational assistant and specialized agents) and the KPMG Clara platform for real‑time audit management.
AI supports documentation, disclosure analysis and modern client communication via Clara for Clients.
Adoption of AI changes the auditor role and requires new competencies and adaptation.
Key implementation concerns are data security, regulatory environment and potential AI‑related risks.
takeaways: Expect more detailed, data‑driven audit scrutiny as full‑population analysis replaces sampling—ensure your systems can supply complete, auditable data.
Prioritize secure data exchange and compliance controls when sharing audit data with AI‑enabled platforms.
Plan for more real‑time interaction with auditors; consider processes and tooling that support continuous reporting and faster responses.
Invest in internal skills (data literacy and familiarity with AI tools) to streamline audits and reduce disruption.
Engage early with auditors on AI use and regulatory expectations to manage potential risks and evidence requirements.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Copilot offers real-time, vision-enabled support for home projects and repairs. It can "see what you see" and provide step-by-step instructions and clear guidance for issues like leaky pipes and overflowing washing machines.
bullets: Real-time visual support for troubleshooting home repairs.
Copilot can view the user's problem and deliver step-by-step instructions.
Examples mentioned: plumbing (leaky pipes) and appliance issues (overflowing washing machines).
Focus on clear, actionable guidance to help users fix problems.
Designed for on-the-spot assistance using the user's visual feed.
takeaways: Vision-enabled, step-by-step guidance can reduce time-to-diagnosis for on-site equipment issues.
Real-time remote assistance may lower the need for specialized technician dispatches.
Clear procedural instructions can help standardize troubleshooting and reduce human error.
Such tools can be leveraged for technician training and remote support workflows in facilities.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer spotlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The game is a 3D real-time strategy RPG and the footage was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Official launch of Arknights: Endfield, a 3D real-time strategy RPG.
Trailer highlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation (MFG).
Captured on GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode.
Description links to official Arknights: Endfield site and NVIDIA DLSS 4 article.
Multiple social channels provided for Arknights: Endfield and NVIDIA GeForce.
takeaways: Use of DLSS 4 MFG implies a need for GPUs that support NVIDIA's latest AI upscaling features when targeting 4K real-time capture or streaming.
Capturing at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 on an RTX 5080 indicates higher GPU compute and power requirements—consider this for procurement and capacity planning.
Workloads using Multi Frame Generation can increase GPU inference utilization, which affects cooling, power provisioning, and instance sizing in data centers.
4K captures and promotional assets increase storage and network bandwidth demands for archiving and distribution.
Cloud/virtual GPU offerings should ensure driver and SDK compatibility with DLSS 4 to support developers and content creators using these features.

items.title: New CO2 Battery Stores 8 Hours of Energy

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this giant bubble of carbon dioxide is presented as a CO2 battery that stores 20 megawatts of energy and provides eight hours of storage. The description says these batteries are meant to smooth fluctuating renewable generation and help power the global shift to clean energy.
bullets: Described as a giant bubble of carbon dioxide functioning as a battery
Stores 20 megawatts of energy
Provides eight hours of energy storage (per the title)
Aims to smooth fluctuating renewable energy generation
Positioned to support the global shift to clean energy
takeaways: Provides 8-hour, 20 MW storage capacity — relevant for multi-hour balancing and backup planning
Intended to smooth renewable generation variability, which is useful for grid reliability strategies
Described as a tool to support decarbonization efforts and long-duration storage planning
Worth considering alongside other storage technologies when evaluating options to integrate renewables
